tweet: One of the oldest women in Canada has just died of Covid 19.  Foon Hay Lum was 111. Her death brings to 26 the number of victims at her LTC home this month. She survived the Spanish Flu, wars, the Cultural Revolution- and she died in isolation in Toronto tonight.

One of the oldest women in Canada has just died of Covid 19.  Foon Hay Lum was 111. Her death brings to 26 the number of victims at her LTC home this month. She survived the Spanish Flu, wars, the Cultural Revolution- and she died in isolation in Toronto tonight.

Can this #pandemic, marked by the horrifying #COVID19 death toll in institutional care, be the crisis that finally forces us to fix long-term care? by @AaronWherry  https://t.co/N13sKf3UoV via @cbcnews #LTC #cdnhealth #cdnpoli
Canada's for-profit model of long-term care has failed the elderly, says leading expert Pat Armstrong   https://t.co/BOHjEWMLr4 via @cbcsunday @davidgutnick #LTC #cdnhealth #COVID19

About 75% of Ontario’s long term care homes haven’t had a single outbreak of COVID-19. A small number are a disaster. Still, we need to finally fix the problems that do exist in LTC once this pandemic is over.  Read & RT #onpoli #COVID19Ontario   https://t.co/5TsAAPYPsL
These are fantastic aspirational goals that cost money.  The only way a compassionate and evidence-based LTC facility can be built and staffed properly is if we pay for it.
These are fantastic aspirational goals that cost money.  The only way a compassionate and evidence-based LTC facility can be built and staffed properly is if we pay for it.

Thanks to Prime Minister @JustinTrudeau and Defence Minister @HarjitSajjan for sending in Canadian military medical staff to save lives in Ontario’s LTC facilities.  Clearly the  @fordnation government has lost control.  72% of deaths in Ontario are LTC home residents.

I don't often retweet @fordnation, but this is great news.   Applies to staff working in LTC, retirement homes, shelters, supportive housing, corrections institutions, home care & others.  Congrats to all the advocates who helped @fordnation get here.

In Ontario we allocate $9.00 a day for food in long term care. Imagine trying to beat #Covid_19 with a lunch of bologna sandwiches and cheetos. @JustinTrudeau @fordnation curious to know what your daily (tax payer) meal allowances are? Asking for my 80k friends in #LTC today.

.@fordnation has done the right thing. $4 premium for workers on the front line of #Covid19 including LTC and retirement and more. Thanks to my union @UniforTheUnion for demanding a pandemic premium. #onpoli @DrFullertonMPP @celliottability Thank you for listening.
